element-citation.source: Merck's 1896 Index: An Encyclopedia for the Physician and the Pharmacist: Stating the Names and Synonyms, Source of Origin, Chemical Nature and Formulas, Physical Form, Appearance, and Properties, Melting and Boiling Points, Solubilities, Gravities and Percentage Strengths, Physiological Effects, Therapeutic Uses, Modes of Administration and Application, Regular and Maximum Dosage, Incompatibles, Antidotes: Special Cautions, Hints on Keeping and Handling, Methods of Testing, Market Values, etc., etc. of the Chemicals and Drugs Used in Medicine, in Chemistry, and in the Arts
